intro: Condaminea corymbosa var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy cluster bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, bell-shaped flowers. The variety pubescens is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a unique texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. The plant produces showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
